description: TypeScript-based e-commerce platform for flower sales
key_features: Product image management with sorting and filtering

quality_checks.typescript: Strict mode enabled in all configurations

recent_fixes: Implemented product image management table in admin panel with sorting functionality
Added new API endpoint /api/images/products-with-counts for retrieving products with image counts
Created ImageService.getProductsWithImageCounts method with sorting support (name, image_count)
Updated admin panel images section with products table showing name, price, and image count columns
Added sorting dropdown with options: image count (default), name ascending, name descending
Implemented modal link for editing images per product (placeholder for future modal implementation)
Ensured TypeScript type consistency across all new methods and interfaces
Updated FloresYaAPI with getProductsWithImageCounts method for frontend integration
Added proper error handling and logging for image management operations
Fixed OrderService.ts numeric type mismatch for prices
Enabled strict typing in tsconfig.dev.json
Removed incorrect path mappings from tsconfig.json
Eliminated all 'any' type annotations
Verified frontend transpilation to ./dist/frontend
Fixed Bootstrap modal types in WindowWithBootstrap interface
Resolved all ESLint errors in admin.ts (removed 'any' types)
Updated global types for proper modal constructor support
Verified controller schema compliance with database types
Implemented comprehensive type safety across all files
Fixed unused variable warning in generateCarouselPositionHTML function
Updated WindowWithBootstrap interface to include Modal constructor
Eliminated all TypeScript compilation errors (0 errors remaining)
Reduced ESLint warnings from 89 to 12 (acceptable for development)
Fixed Vercel deployment configuration for CommonJS compatibility
Updated tsconfig.prod.json for Vercel Node.js runtime compatibility
Fixed import.meta.url usage for CommonJS modules in server.ts
Updated vercel.json with proper build configuration
Fixed Vercel functions/builds configuration conflict by removing functions property
Established production-ready foundation with strict typing
Successfully resolved all Vercel deployment configuration issues
Achieved successful Vercel deployment with production URL
Updated Supabase schema to be fully executable with proper enum type definitions
Added CREATE TYPE statements for all enums: occasion_type, order_status, payment_status, payment_method_type, user_role, image_size
Created sequences for all tables to ensure proper auto-increment functionality
Replaced USER-DEFINED placeholders with actual enum types in table definitions
Updated UserRole type in supabase.ts to include 'support' role for consistency
Verified schema matches all controller operations and TypeScript interfaces
Schema now ready for direct execution in Supabase database

Added missing RPC functions to schema for atomic operations: create_order_with_items, update_order_status_with_history, create_product_with_occasions, update_carousel_order_atomic, create_user_atomic, update_user_atomic, toggle_user_active_atomic, delete_user_atomic, create_product_images_atomic, delete_product_images_safe

Updated UserController and UserService to use unified type definitions from supabase.ts

Added JSDoc documentation to service methods for better code maintainability
